findings.title: Unbounded loop in insertNnumbers leading to gas exhaustion
findings.explanation: The insertNnumbers function lets callers specify an arbitrary 'numbers' value, which drives a storage‐writing loop. If 'numbers' is large enough, the transaction will run out of gas or exceed the block gas limit, effectively causing a denial-of-service for this contract.
findings.fix_suggestion: Enforce a reasonable maximum on the 'numbers' parameter (e.g., require(numbers <= MAX_BATCH_SIZE)), split large operations into smaller batched calls, or move heavy storage writes off-chain and use events or pagination to limit per-transaction gas usage.
